page.title: 02THE STORY PLACE NAMES TELL
page.content: { Buck}farm,{Buck}Street and{Doe}Park reservoir remind us of the large deer park used by the Tempest family in the l6th century for hunting parties. {Denholme Gate,Lodge Gate}and { {Thorngate}indicate the outskirts of the park. The{Little Bull,Brown Cow}and{Shoulder {of Mutton}, all names of public houses, reflect the farming community, whilst the{Dog and Gun}highlights a sporting activity. {Foster Park Road,Grove}etc.remind us of the{Foster family }(see P.3) {Station}Road recalls a former method of transport and {Minorca}Mount the former farm on that site. {Clock Lane,Wheelrace Cottages, {Hillcrest Road, Beech Drive}are self-explanatory.
